result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Desmariegh A. Meyer
Current: 4311 Schofield Avenue, Lot 99, Weston, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2015)

Case called: 11:40 am
Includes 15CM821, 15CM982, 15CM1531, 15TR2034
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Paul Goetz;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
15CM821:
Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>DRI.

15CM982:
Ct. 1 (BJ)>>DRI.

15CM1531:
Ct. 1 (BJ)>>Dismiss Outright.
Ct. 2 (BJ)>>Dismiss Outright.

15TR2034:
Ct. 1 (Refuse to Take Test for Intoxication After Arrest)>>Dismiss Outright.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CM821:
Ct. 3 (OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 yrs old))>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: $1064 fine inclusive of Court Costs, 5 days MCJ w/Huber for work/school/treatment/child care or combination, 12 months D.L. revocation, AODA unless already completed. Defendant has 45 days to report to jail. No objection to EMP. COURT finds 1 day credit.

Adjourned: 11:49 am

AMENDED Includes 15CM821 and 15CM982.  Defendant may have contact with L.A.K. as often and at such times as the MCDSS deems appropriate-provided such visits are supervised by the defendant's Mother L.M. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 1 business day with DAY REPORTING.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety as to alcohol and controlled substances with exception of VFW for work purposes only, provided defendant is sober.   Defendant must be in full compliance with DSS directives and rules.

COURT DOES NOT FORFEIT BOND.
